deeptrees.dataloadingïƒ

deeptrees.dataloading.datamoduleïƒ

class deeptrees.dataloading.datamodule.TreeCrownDelineationDataModule(rasters, masks, outlines, distance_transforms, training_split=0.7, batch_size=16, val_batch_size=2, num_workers=8, augment_train={}, augment_eval={}, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, divide_by=1, dilate_outlines=0, shuffle=True, train_indices=None, val_indices=None, test_indices=None, ground_truth_config={'labels': None})[source]ïƒ

Bases: LightningDataModule

This class is responsible for managing the datasets, applying preprocessing steps, and providing DataLoaders for training, validation, testing, and prediction.

rastersïƒ

List of file paths, or path to folder containing the training raster files (TIF).

Type:

Union[str, list]

Type:

Type:

Type:

Number of workers in DataLoader. Defaults to 8.

Type:

int

Dictionary defining torchvision augmentations to be used during training. Defaults to {}.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

Dictionary defining torchvision augmentations to be used during validation/testing. Defaults to {}.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

Dictionary defining the NDVI concatenation settings. Defaults to {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

divide_byïƒ

Scalar used to normalize rasters. Defaults to 1.

Type:

float

dilate_outlinesïƒ

If present (>0), dilate outlines by the given number of pixels. Defaults to 0.

Type:

int

shuffleïƒ

If True, shuffle data before applying split. Defaults to True.

Type:

bool

train_indicesïƒ

List of indices of files to be used for training. Cannot be used with shuffle. Defaults to None.

Type:

list[int]

List of indices of files to be used for validation. Cannot be used with shuffle. Defaults to None.

Type:

__init__(rasters, masks, outlines, distance_transforms, training_split=0.7, batch_size=16, val_batch_size=2, num_workers=8, augment_train={}, augment_eval={}, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, divide_by=1, dilate_outlines=0, shuffle=True, train_indices=None, val_indices=None, test_indices=None, ground_truth_config={'labels': None})[source]ïƒ

TreeCrownDelineationDataModule

Datamodule to hold the different datasets, apply preprocessing, and return DataLoaders.

Parameters:

  • rasters (Union[str, list]) â€“ List of file paths, or path to folder containing the training raster files (TIF).

  • masks (Union[str, list]) â€“ List of file paths, or path to folder containing the masks.

  • outlines (Union[str, list]) â€“ List of file paths, or path to folder containing the outlines.

  • distance_transforms (Union[str, list]) â€“ List of file paths, or path to folder containing the distance transforms.

  • training_split (float, optional) â€“ Training data split. Defaults to 0.7.

  • batch_size (int, optional) â€“ Training batch size. Defaults to 16.

  • val_batch_size (int, optional) â€“ Validation batch size. Defaults to 2.

  • num_workers (int, optional) â€“ Number of workers in DataLoader. Defaults to 8.

  • augment_train (Dict[str, Any], optional) â€“ Dictionary defining torchvision augmentations to be used during training. Defaults to {}.

  • augment_eval (Dict[str, Any], optional) â€“ Dictionary defining torchvision augmentations to be used during validation/testing. Defaults to {}.

  • ndvi_config (_type_, optional) â€“ Dictionary defining the NDVI concatenation settings. Defaults to {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}.

  • divide_by (float, optional) â€“ Scalar used to normalize rasters. Defaults to 1.

  • dilate_outlines (int, optional) â€“ If present (>0), dilate outlines be given number of pixels. Defaults to False (=0).

  • shuffle (bool, optional) â€“ If True, shuffle data before applying split. Defaults to True.

  • train_indices (list[int], optional) â€“ List of indices of files to be used for training. Cannot be used with shuffle. Defaults to None.

  • val_indices (list[int], optional) â€“ List of indices of files to be used for validation. Cannot be used with shuffle. Defaults to None.

  • test_indices (list[int], optional) â€“ List of indices of files to be used for testing. Cannot be used with shuffle. Defaults to None.

  • ground_truth_config (Dict[str, Any], optional) â€“ Dictionary defining the ground truth preprocessing settings. Defaults to {â€˜labelsâ€™: None}.

deeptrees.dataloading.datasetsïƒ

class deeptrees.dataloading.datasets.TreeCrownDelineationBaseDataset(raster_files, target_files, augmentation, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, dilate_outlines=0, overwrite_nan_with_zeros=True, in_memory=True, dim_ordering='CHW', dtype='float32', divide_by=1)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ABC

In-memory remote sensing dataset for image segmentation.

This base dataset class handles the loading and preprocessing of raster and target files for tree crown delineation, and image segmentation task.

Parameters: - raster_files (list[str]): List of file paths to the raster images. - target_files (list[str]): List of file paths to the target images. - augmentation (Dict[str, Any]): Dictionary containing augmentation configurations. - ndvi_config (Dict[str, Any], optional): Configuration for NDVI, default is {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}. - dilate_outlines (int, optional): Number of pixels to dilate the outlines, default is 0. - overwrite_nan_with_zeros (bool, optional): Whether to overwrite NaN values with zeros, default is True. - in_memory (bool, optional): Whether to load the data into memory, default is True. - dim_ordering (str, optional): Dimension ordering, default is â€œCHWâ€. - dtype (str, optional): Data type of the raster images, default is â€œfloat32â€. - divide_by (int, optional): Value to divide the raster data by, default is 1.

__init__(raster_files, target_files, augmentation, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, dilate_outlines=0, overwrite_nan_with_zeros=True, in_memory=True, dim_ordering='CHW', dtype='float32', divide_by=1)[source]ïƒ

Creates a dataset containing images and targets (masks, outlines, and distance_transforms).

Parameters:

  • raster_files (list[str]) â€“ List of file paths to source rasters. File names must be of the form â€˜â€¦/the_name_i.tifâ€™ where i is some index

  • target_files (list[str]) â€“ mask_files: A tuple containing lists of file paths to different sorts of â€˜masksâ€™, e.g. mask, outline, distance transform. The mask and raster file names must have the same index ending.

  • augmentation (Dict[str, Any]) â€“ Dictionary defining augmentations. Keys correspond to torchvision transforms, values to their kwargs.

  • ndvi_config (_type_, optional) â€“ Dictionary defining NDVI concatenation. Defaults to {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}.

  • dilate_outlines (int, optional) â€“ If present, dilate outlines by give amount of pixels. Defaults to 0.

  • overwrite_nan_with_zeros (bool, optional) â€“ If True, fill missing values in targets with 0. Defaults to True.

  • in_memory (bool, optional) â€“ If True, load all rasters and targets into memory (works for small datasets, beware of OOM error). Defaults to True.

  • dim_ordering (str, optional) â€“ Order of dimensions. Defaults to â€œCHWâ€.

  • dtype (str, optional) â€“ torch Datatype. Defaults to â€œfloat32â€.

  • divide_by (int, optional) â€“ Scalar to divide the raster pixel values by. Defaults to 1.

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>ïƒ
static concatenate_ndvi_to_raster(raster, red=0, nir=3, dim_ordering='CHW', rescale=False)[source]ïƒ

Concatenate NDVI to the raster.

Parameters:

  • raster (xr.Dataset) â€“ loaded raster tile

  • red (int, optional) â€“ Index of red channel in raster bands. Defaults to 0.

  • nir (int, optional) â€“ Index of NIR channel in raster bands. Defaults to 3.

  • rescale (bool, optional) â€“ Rescale NDVI to [0, 1]. Defaults to False.

Returns:

_description_

Return type:

xr.Dataset

class deeptrees.dataloading.datasets.TreeCrownDelineationDataset(raster_files, target_files, augmentation, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, dilate_outlines=0, overwrite_nan_with_zeros=True, in_memory=True, dim_ordering='CHW', dtype='float32', divide_by=1)[source]ïƒ

Bases: TreeCrownDelineationBaseDataset, IterableDataset

Iterable TreeCrownDelineation dataset.

Yields samples from all rasters until, statistically, each pixel has been covered once. If the raster edge length exceeds the sample edge length, this implies that multiple samples can be sampled from one raster.

__init__(raster_files, target_files, augmentation, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, dilate_outlines=0, overwrite_nan_with_zeros=True, in_memory=True, dim_ordering='CHW', dtype='float32', divide_by=1)[source]ïƒ

Creates a dataset containing images and targets (masks, outlines, and distance_transforms).

Parameters:

  • raster_files (list[str]) â€“ List of file paths to source rasters. File names must be of the form â€˜â€¦/the_name_i.tifâ€™ where i is some index

  • target_files (list[str]) â€“ mask_files: A tuple containing lists of file paths to different sorts of â€˜masksâ€™, e.g. mask, outline, distance transform. The mask and raster file names must have the same index ending.

  • augmentation (Dict[str, Any]) â€“ Dictionary defining augmentations. Keys correspond to torchvision transforms, values to their kwargs.

  • ndvi_config (_type_, optional) â€“ Dictionary defining NDVI concatenation. Defaults to {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}.

  • dilate_outlines (int, optional) â€“ If present, dilate outlines by give amount of pixels. Defaults to 0.

  • overwrite_nan_with_zeros (bool, optional) â€“ If True, fill missing values in targets with 0. Defaults to True.

  • in_memory (bool, optional) â€“ If True, load all rasters and targets into memory (works for small datasets, beware of OOM error). Defaults to True.

  • dim_ordering (str, optional) â€“ Order of dimensions. Defaults to â€œCHWâ€.

  • dtype (str, optional) â€“ torch Datatype. Defaults to â€œfloat32â€.

  • divide_by (int, optional) â€“ Scalar to divide the raster pixel values by. Defaults to 1.

class deeptrees.dataloading.datasets.TreeCrownDelineationInferenceDataset(raster_files, augmentation, ndvi_config={'concatenate': False}, dilate_outlines=0, overwrite_nan_with_zeros=True, in_memory=True, dim_ordering='CHW', dtype='float32', divide_by=1)[source]ïƒ

Bases: TreeCrownDelineationBaseDataset, Dataset

Map-style (â€œstandardâ€) dataset for the TreeCrownDelineation data.

This dataset is used for inference and returns complete rasters along with selected metadata.

Parameters: - raster_files (list[str]): List of file paths to the raster images. - augmentation (Dict[str, Any]): Dictionary containing augmentation configurations. - ndvi_config (Dict[str, Any], optional): Configuration for NDVI, default is {â€˜concatenateâ€™: False}. - dilate_outlines (int, optional): Number of pixels to dilate the outlines, default is 0. - overwrite_nan_with_zeros (bool, optional): Whether to overwrite NaN values with zeros, default is True. - in_memory (bool, optional): Whether to load the data into memory, default is True. - dim_ordering (str, optional): Dimension ordering, default is â€œCHWâ€. - dtype (str, optional): Data type of the raster images, default is â€œfloat32â€. - divide_by (int, optional): Value to divide the raster data by, default is 1.

deeptrees.dataloading.preprocessingïƒ

Classes to be used in preprocessing labels -> ground truth rasters

Based on scripts/rasterize.py and scripts/rasterize_to_distance_transform.py

class deeptrees.dataloading.preprocessing.DistanceTransformGenerator(rasters, output_path, output_file_prefix, ground_truth_labels, valid_class_ids='all', class_column_name='class', crs='EPSG:25832', nproc=1, area_max=None, area_min=3)[source]ïƒ

__init__(rasters, output_path, output_file_prefix, ground_truth_labels, valid_class_ids='all', class_column_name='class', crs='EPSG:25832', nproc=1, area_max=None, area_min=3)[source]ïƒ

Initialize the MaskOutlinesGenerator instance.

Parameters:

  • rasters (Union[str, list]) â€“ (List of) file path(s) to the raster files

  • output_path (str) â€“ Output directory

  • output_file_prefix (str) â€“ Output file prefix. Suffix is infered from raster files.

  • ground_truth_labels (Union[str, gpd.GeoDataFrame]) â€“ Path to ground truth labels or frame with labels

  • nproc (int, optional) â€“ Number of parallel processes to use. Defaults to 1.

  • valid_class_ids (Union[str, list]) â€“ Valid class IDs in ground_truth_labels. Defaults to â€˜allâ€™ (use all classes).

  • class_column_name (str) â€“ Column name of class ID in ground_truth_labels.

  • crs (str) â€“ Coordinate reference system. Defaults to EPSG:25832.

  • area_max (int) â€“ Maximum area of polygons to consider. Defaults to None.

  • area_min (int) â€“ Minimum area of polygons to consider. Defaults to 3.

process(input_file)[source]ïƒ

process Create raster distance_transform from input tile

The distance transform is normalized per polygon (better for instance segmentation).

Parameters:

input_file (str) â€“ input raster file

class deeptrees.dataloading.preprocessing.GroundTruthGenerator(rasters, output_path, output_file_prefix, ground_truth_labels, valid_class_ids='all', class_column_name='class', crs='EPSG:25832', nproc=1)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ABC

Base class to generate ground truth (masks, outlines, distance transforms)

Loads a raster and a vector file, then rasterizes the vector file within the extent of the raster with the same resolution. Uses gdal_rasterize under the hood, but provides some more features like specifying which classes to rasterize into which layer of the output. If you want to infer the output file names, the input file name suffixes have to be delimited by an â€˜_â€™.â€,

Based on scripts/rasterize.py in Freudenberg 2022.

__init__(rasters, output_path, output_file_prefix, ground_truth_labels, valid_class_ids='all', class_column_name='class', crs='EPSG:25832', nproc=1)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • rasters (Union[str, list]) â€“ (List of) file path(s) to the raster files

  • output_path (str) â€“ Output directory

  • output_file_prefix (str) â€“ Output file prefix. Suffix is infered from raster files.

  • ground_truth_labels (Union[str, gpd.GeoDataFrame]) â€“ Path to ground truth labels or frame with labels

  • nproc (int, optional) â€“ Number of parallel processes to use. Defaults to 1.

  • valid_class_ids (Union[str, list]) â€“ Valid class IDs in ground_truth_labels. Defaults to â€˜allâ€™ (use all classes).

  • class_column_name (str) â€“ Column name of class ID in ground_truth_labels.

  • crs (str) â€“ Coordinate reference system. Defaults to EPSG:25832.

  • output_file_prefix (str) â€“ Output file prefix. Suffix is infered from raster files.

  • ground_truth_labels (Union[str, gpd.GeoDataFrame]) â€“ Path to ground truth labels or frame with labels

  • nproc (int, optional) â€“ Number of parallel processes to use. Defaults to 1.

  • crs (str) â€“ Coordinate reference system. Defaults to EPSG:25832.

  • generate_outlines (bool) â€“ If True, generate outlines. If False, generate masks. Defaults to False.
